zh-cn: 理查德·米尔豪斯·尼克松

description.zh-cn: 美国政治人物，曾于1969年至1974年担任第37任美国总统，是美国历史上唯一一位在任期内因水门事件辞职下台的总统。他曾于1953至1961年担任第36任美国副总统。在其总统任内，他以外交政策闻名，包括结束美国在越南战争中的参与、与中国建立关系、与苏联达成缓和政策及签署反弹道导弹条约。国内方面，他建立了环境保护局，并推行了价格管制、种族融合和向毒品宣战等政策。
description.en: An American politician who served as the 37th President of the United States from 1969 to 1974, becoming the only U.S. president to resign from office due to the Watergate scandal. He previously served as the 36th Vice President of the United States from 1953 to 1961. As president, he was known for his foreign policy, including ending American involvement in the Vietnam War, establishing relations with China, and initiating détente and the Anti-Ballistic Missile Treaty with the Soviet Union. Domestically, he established the Environmental Protection Agency and oversaw policies such as price controls, school desegregation, and the War on Drugs.

description.zh-cn: 美利坚合众国的国家元首、政府首脑与三军统帅。
description.en: The head of state and head of government of the United States of America, and commander-in-chief of the armed forces.

description.zh-cn: 美国政治人物，曾担任第38任美国总统。在尼克松政府后期担任副总统，并在尼克松辞职后继任总统。
description.en: An American politician who served as the 38th President of the United States. He served as Vice President during the latter part of the Nixon administration and succeeded to the presidency upon Nixon's resignation.

description.zh-cn: 美国政治人物，曾于1969年至1973年担任第39任美国副总统，后因腐败丑闻辞职。
description.en: An American politician who served as the 39th Vice President of the United States from 1969 to 1973, before resigning due to a corruption scandal.

nodes.id: 德怀特·大卫·艾森豪威尔

zh-cn: 德怀特·大卫·艾森豪威尔

description.zh-cn: 美国军事家、政治家，曾担任第34任美国总统。
description.en: An American military officer and statesman who served as the 34th President of the United States.

en: Vice President of the United States

description.zh-cn: 美利坚合众国排名第二的行政官员，仅次于总统。
description.en: The second-highest officer in the executive branch of the U.S. federal government, after the president.

description.zh-cn: 美国的两个主要政党之一。
description.en: One of the two major contemporary political parties in the United States.

description.zh-cn: 理查德·尼克松的妻子，在1969年至1974年期间担任美国第一夫人。
description.en: Wife of Richard Nixon and First Lady of the United States from 1969 to 1974.

nodes.id: 特里西娅·尼克松·考克斯

zh-cn: 特里西娅·尼克松·考克斯

description.zh-cn: 理查德·尼克松和帕特·尼克松的长女。
description.en: The elder daughter of Richard and Pat Nixon.

nodes.id: 朱莉·尼克松·艾森豪威尔

zh-cn: 朱莉·尼克松·艾森豪威尔

description.zh-cn: 理查德·尼克松和帕特·尼克松的幼女，德怀特·艾森豪威尔的孙媳。
description.en: The younger daughter of Richard and Pat Nixon, and the granddaughter-in-law of Dwight D. Eisenhower.

description.zh-cn: 位于美国加利福尼亚州惠提尔的私立文理学院。
description.en: A private liberal arts college in Whittier, California.

description.zh-cn: 杜克大学下属的法学院。
description.en: The law school of Duke University.

description.zh-cn: 美国武装力量的海上军种。
description.en: The naval warfare service branch of the United States Armed Forces.

description.zh-cn: 一场全球性的军事冲突，是人类历史上规模最大的战争。
description.en: A global military conflict, the largest in human history.

description.zh-cn: 前美国国务院官员，在1948年被指控为苏联间谍，后因伪证罪被定罪。
description.en: A former U.S. State Department official who was accused of being a Soviet spy in 1948 and later convicted of perjury.

description.zh-cn: 美国政治人物，曾担任第35任美国总统，在1960年总统选举中击败尼克松。
description.en: An American politician who served as the 35th President of the United States, defeating Nixon in the 1960 presidential election.

description.zh-cn: 一场始于1970年代初的美国重大政治丑闻，最终导致理查德·尼克松总统辞职。
description.en: A major political scandal in the United States involving the administration of U.S. President Richard Nixon from 1972 to 1974 that led to Nixon's resignation.

description.zh-cn: 美国总统理查德·尼克松于1972年2月对中华人民共和国的历史性访问，是中美关系正常化的重要一步。
description.en: A historic visit by U.S. President Richard Nixon to the People's Republic of China in February 1972, which was an important step in normalizing relations between the two countries.

description.zh-cn: 位于东亚的国家，是尼克松总统历史性访问的目的地。
description.en: A country in East Asia, destination of President Nixon's historic visit.

description.zh-cn: 中国革命家、政治家、理论家，中华人民共和国的主要缔造者和第一代核心领导人。在1972年尼克松访华期间与其会面。
description.en: A Chinese communist revolutionary who was the founder of the People's Republic of China. He met with Nixon during his 1972 visit.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国第一任国务院总理，在1972年尼克松访华期间接待了尼克松。
description.en: The first Premier of the People's Republic of China, who hosted President Nixon during his 1972 visit.

description.zh-cn: 发生在东南亚的一场长期战争，是冷战时期的一部分。尼克松在其总统任内致力于结束美国在该战争中的参与。
description.en: A long, costly armed conflict in Southeast Asia that was part of the Cold War. Nixon worked to end American involvement in the war during his presidency.

description.zh-cn: 美国和苏联之间签署的军备控制条约，旨在限制反弹道导弹系统的部署。
description.en: An arms control treaty between the United States and the Soviet Union on the limitation of the anti-ballistic missile (ABM) systems used in defending areas against ballistic missile-delivered nuclear weapons.

description.zh-cn: 一个前欧亚社会主义国家，是冷战时期美国的主要对手。尼克松政府对其推行缓和政策。
description.en: A former socialist state in Eurasia that was the main adversary of the United States during the Cold War. The Nixon administration pursued a policy of détente with it.

nodes.id: 列昂尼德·伊里奇·勃列日涅夫

zh-cn: 列昂尼德·伊里奇·勃列日涅夫

description.zh-cn: 苏联政治家，在1964年至1982年期间担任苏联共产党中央委员会总书记，与尼克松进行了多次会晤和谈判。
description.en: A Soviet politician who led the Soviet Union as General Secretary of the Communist Party from 1964 to 1982. He met and negotiated with Nixon on several occasions.

description.zh-cn: 1973年10月，由埃及和叙利亚领导的阿拉伯国家联盟对以色列发动的战争。尼克松政府在此期间向以色列提供了关键的军事援助。
description.en: A war fought in October 1973 by a coalition of Arab states led by Egypt and Syria against Israel. The Nixon administration provided crucial military aid to Israel during the conflict.

description.zh-cn: 位于中东的国家，在赎罪日战争期间得到尼克松政府的军事支持。
description.en: A country in the Middle East that received military support from the Nixon administration during the Yom Kippur War.

description.zh-cn: 美国外交家和政治学者，在尼克松政府期间担任国家安全顾问和国务卿，是尼克松外交政策的主要制定者。
description.en: An American diplomat and political scientist who served as National Security Advisor and later concurrently as Secretary of State in the Nixon administration, and was a major architect of Nixon's foreign policy.

description.zh-cn: 负责保护人类健康和环境的美国联邦政府机构。
description.en: An agency of the U.S. federal government whose mission is to protect human and environmental health.

description.zh-cn: 美国历史学家和政治人物，是1972年美国总统选举中的民主党候选人，被尼克松以压倒性优势击败。
description.en: An American historian and politician who was the Democratic Party nominee in the 1972 presidential election, losing to Nixon in a landslide.

description.zh-cn: 美国调查记者，与鲍勃·伍德沃德一起在《华盛顿邮报》揭露了水门事件。
description.en: An American investigative journalist who, with Bob Woodward, broke the Watergate scandal for The Washington Post.

description.zh-cn: 美国调查记者，与卡尔·伯恩斯坦一起在《华盛顿邮报》揭露了水门事件。
description.en: An American investigative journalist who, with Carl Bernstein, broke the Watergate scandal for The Washington Post.

description.zh-cn: 前联邦调查局副局长，是向《华盛顿邮报》泄露水门事件信息的线人“深喉”。
description.en: A former Federal Bureau of Investigation official who was the informant known as "Deep Throat" who provided information about the Watergate scandal to The Washington Post.

description.zh-cn: 美国律师，担任水门事件特别检察官，在“星期六之夜大屠杀”中被尼克松解雇。
description.en: An American lawyer who served as the Watergate Special Prosecutor and was fired by Nixon in the "Saturday Night Massacre".

description.zh-cn: 尼克松总统一系列解雇和辞职事件的名称，起因于他命令解雇水门事件特别检察官阿奇博尔德·考克斯。
description.en: The term used for President Nixon's series of dismissals and resignations, which began with his order to fire Special Prosecutor Archibald Cox.

description.zh-cn: 中国政治家，中华人民共和国第二代核心领导人。在尼克松下台后多次与其会面。
description.en: A Chinese politician who was the paramount leader of the People's Republic of China from 1978 to 1989. He met with Nixon several times after Nixon left office.

description.zh-cn: 在斯皮罗·阿格纽辞职后，杰拉尔德·福特被尼克松提名为副总统。
description.en: Gerald Ford was nominated by Nixon to be Vice President after Spiro Agnew's resignation.

relationships.target: 德怀特·大卫·艾森豪威尔

relationships.source: 特里西娅·尼克松·考克斯
朱莉·尼克松·艾森豪威尔

description.zh-cn: 尼克松在第二次世界大战期间于美国海军服役。
description.en: Nixon served in the U.S. Navy during World War II.

description.zh-cn: 作为众议院非美活动委员会成员，尼克松在调查阿尔杰·希斯间谍案中发挥了关键作用，最终导致希斯因伪证罪被定罪。
description.en: As a member of the House Un-American Activities Committee, Nixon played a key role in the investigation of the Alger Hiss spy case, which led to Hiss's conviction for perjury.

description.zh-cn: 在1960年美国总统选举中，尼克松以微弱劣势败给肯尼迪。
description.en: Nixon was narrowly defeated by Kennedy in the 1960 United States presidential election.

description.zh-cn: 水门事件的不断发酵导致尼克松失去政治支持，最终迫使他辞去总统职务。
description.en: The escalating Watergate scandal led to a loss of political support for Nixon, ultimately forcing him to resign from the presidency.

description.zh-cn: 尼克松于1972年对中华人民共和国进行历史性访问，开启了两国外交关系正常化的新篇章。
description.en: Nixon made a historic visit to the People's Republic of China in 1972, opening a new chapter in the normalization of diplomatic relations between the two countries.

description.zh-cn: 在1972年访华期间与时任中国共产党中央委员会主席毛泽东会面，探讨了一系列问题。
description.en: Met with Chairman of the Chinese Communist Party Mao Zedong during his 1972 visit to China to discuss a range of issues.

description.zh-cn: 在1972年访华期间与时任中国国务院总理周恩来举行会谈。
description.en: Held talks with Chinese Premier Zhou Enlai during his 1972 visit to China.

description.zh-cn: 尼克松实施“越南化”政策，逐步撤出美国军队，并最终在1973年签署《巴黎和平协约》，结束了美国的直接军事介入。
description.en: Nixon implemented the policy of "Vietnamization" to gradually withdraw U.S. troops and ultimately signed the Paris Peace Accords in 1973, ending direct U.S. military involvement.

description.zh-cn: 在1972年莫斯科峰会期间，尼克松与苏联领导人勃列日涅夫签署了《反弹道导弹条约》。
description.en: During the 1972 Moscow Summit, Nixon signed the Anti-Ballistic Missile Treaty with Soviet leader Leonid Brezhnev.

relationships.target: 列昂尼德·伊里奇·勃列日涅夫

description.zh-cn: 1972年首次在莫斯科会晤，开启了美苏关系的“缓和”时代，并签署了多项军控协议。
description.en: First met in Moscow in 1972, initiating an era of "détente" in U.S.-Soviet relations and signing several arms control agreements.

description.zh-cn: 在1973年赎罪日战争期间，尼克松下令对以色列进行大规模空运军事援助，行动代号“五分钱救援行动”，这对于扭转战局至关重要。
description.en: During the 1973 Yom Kippur War, Nixon ordered a massive military airlift to Israel, codenamed Operation Nickel Grass, which was crucial in turning the tide of the war.

position.zh-cn: 国家安全顾问, 国务卿
position.en: National Security Advisor, Secretary of State

description.zh-cn: 基辛格是尼克松政府外交政策的关键人物，与总统密切合作。
description.en: Kissinger was a key figure in the Nixon administration's foreign policy, working closely with the president.

description.zh-cn: 尼克松总统于1970年宣布组建美国国家环境保护局。
description.en: President Nixon announced the formation of the Environmental Protection Agency in 1970.

description.zh-cn: 在1972年美国总统选举中，尼克松以压倒性优势击败了民主党候选人乔治·麦戈文，成功连任。
description.en: In the 1972 United States presidential election, Nixon defeated Democratic candidate George McGovern in a landslide to win re-election.

description.zh-cn: 作为《华盛顿邮报》的记者，与鲍勃·伍德沃德的调查性报道揭露了水门事件，最终导致尼克松辞职。
description.en: As a Washington Post reporter, his investigative reporting with Bob Woodward uncovered the Watergate scandal, which ultimately led to Nixon's resignation.

description.zh-cn: 作为《华盛顿邮报》的记者，与卡尔·伯恩斯坦的调查性报道揭露了水门事件，最终导致尼克松辞职。
description.en: As a Washington Post reporter, his investigative reporting with Carl Bernstein uncovered the Watergate scandal, which ultimately led to Nixon's resignation.

description.zh-cn: 作为联邦调查局副局长，马克·费尔特是被称为“深喉”的线人，他向记者泄露了有关水门事件的关键信息。
description.en: As Associate Director of the FBI, Mark Felt was the informant known as "Deep Throat" who leaked critical information about the Watergate scandal to journalists.

description.zh-cn: 尼克松下令解雇水门事件特别检察官阿奇博尔德·考克斯，引发了“星期六之夜大屠杀”事件。
description.en: Nixon ordered the firing of Watergate Special Prosecutor Archibald Cox, triggering the "Saturday Night Massacre".

description.zh-cn: 福特总统宣布给予尼克松“全面、自由且绝对的赦免”，使其免受因水门事件而可能面临的任何刑事起诉。
description.en: President Ford granted Nixon a "full, free, and absolute pardon," protecting him from any criminal prosecution for his actions in the Watergate scandal.

description.zh-cn: 1979年，尼克松应卡特总统邀请，在白宫参加接待时任中国国务院副总理邓小平的国宴，并与其私下会晤。
description.en: In 1979, at President Carter's invitation, Nixon attended a state dinner at the White House for visiting Chinese Vice Premier Deng Xiaoping and held a private meeting with him.
